raw_text:
Berlin celebrates European cinema
 
 Organisers say this year's Berlin Film Festival, which opens on Thursday with period epic Man to Man, will celebrate a revitalised European cinema.
 
 Of the 21 films in competition for the Golden and Silver Bear awards, more than half are from Europe with France particularly well represented. Festival director Dieter Kosslick says this strong showing signals "a new consciousness for European films". "They're on an incredible winning streak," he told the Reuters agency. "This isn't to say there aren't any good American films," he continued. "It's just that there are more good European films."
 
 However, Mr Kosslick refused to accept that widespread opposition to the Iraq war had turned audiences against Hollywood imports. "There is no anti-American mood," he said. Some 350 films will be screened at this year's festival, with a further 300 shown at the European Film Market that runs alongside it. More than a dozen celebrities are scheduled to attend, among them Will Smith, Kevin Spacey and Keanu Reeves. But Mr Kosslick says more would be coming had the Academy Awards not been brought forward to 27 February. "I'm not worried that we won't be able to fill the red carpet with stars," he said, though he admitted the festival may be moved to January next year to avoid a similar clash. The 10-day Berlinale runs until 20 February.
llama3.2:1b: Berlin celebrates European cinema with 350 films and more than 300 screenings at the European Film Market. The festival will celebrate a revitalized European cinema, despite criticism of Hollywood's dominance. Director Dieter Kosslick says this year's lineup signals "a new consciousness for European films" while also acknowledging there are good American films.
llama3.2:3b: Berlin's film festival will celebrate European cinema, featuring over half of its 21 competition films from Europe, particularly France. Festival director Dieter Kosslick attributes the strong showing to a "new consciousness for European films" and says American films are not inferior but more prevalent. The festival will feature around 350 films and several celebrity attendees, although some may have been delayed due to the Academy Awards' new date.
gemma2:2b: The 2023 Berlin Film Festival celebrates a revitalized European cinema, with over half of the competition films coming from Europe. While acknowledging that American films remain strong contenders, festival director Dieter Kosslick believes European filmmaking is on an upward trajectory. The festival will screen 350 films and feature celebrities like Will Smith, Kevin Spacey, and Keanu Reeves.  The 10-day event runs until February 20th.
qwen2.5:0.5b: The European cinema is celebrating in Berlin this year with the Berlin Film Festival (BF), which opens on Thursday and features films from Germany, France, Italy, Spain, and other countries. More than half of the 21 films in competition for the Golden and Silver Bear awards are from Europe, with France leading. However, Dieter Kosslick emphasizes that European movies have been making progress recently, noting that American films aren't as good. Despite this, Mr. Kosslick claims there's no widespread opposition to the war in Iraq and admits more screenings will take place at the film market next year due to the Academy Awards. The festival runs from February 10-20.
qwen2.5:1.5b: The 2019 Berlin Film Festival showcases European cinema, with more than half of the 21 competition films coming from Europe, including France well-represented. Despite opposition to the Iraq war, festival director Dieter Kosslick maintains that there are no anti-American moods. The event features 350 screenings and over a dozen celebrities, scheduled for January 2019 in Berlin.
qwen2.5:3b: Berlin celebrates European cinema this year’s Berlin Film Festival opens with period epic Man to Man and features more than half of its competition films from Europe, particularly France. Director Dieter Kosslick highlights a strong showing that signals a new consciousness for European films despite some American critics’ opposition to Hollywood imports. The festival screens 650 films in total over ten days, including guest appearances by Will Smith, Kevin Spacey and Keanu Reeves, but may be moved to January next year to avoid clashing with the Academy Awards.

tinydolphin:1.1b:
Organisers of the Berlin Film Festival (BFF) are celebrating this year's edition with an emphasis on European cinema, particularly France. The festival opens on Thursday with a double-bill of films: one from a country that has been a strong player in the industry and another that is experiencing a resurgence. This showcases the fact that there are not just American but also French films excelling. Despite the negative sentiment surrounding certain aspects of Iraq's war, Mr. Kosslick (the festival director) remains confident about the future of European cinema.

Furthermore, 350 films will be screened at this year’s Berlinale, with a larger number being shown at the European Film Market. Both festivals are scheduled to run from February 27 to March 6. The BFF will host a total of 375 screenings, including more than a dozen celebrities who will be in attendance. Actor Will Smith, actor Kevin Spacey and director Keanu Reeves will be among those expected at the event.
